alert.note: Alert for Clay; Knox; Leslie; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 7:39PM EDT until May 07 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Bell, Clay, Knox, Leslie and Perry. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated additional light to moderate rain is falling due to another round of showers and thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hazard, Barbourville, Hyden, Vicco, Spring Creek, Creekville, Roark, Marcum, Queendale, Essie, Skidmore, Bobs Fork, Ashers Fork, Bear Branch, Gardner, Hosea, Big Creek, Peabody, Warbranch and Asher. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
